subject: Julie Chen: Keeping An Eye On Gas Consumption
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 







 May 2, 
      2007
  
      
 

   Hi everybody,
Oil information expert Tom 
      Kloza warned us this morning about the gradual increases we're seeing in 
      gas prices. The amazing thing is, he says on his blog that if we all 
      conserved about two percent of 
      our normal use of gas, we'd probably be able to keep costs down for all of 
      us at the pump. Just goes to show you that a little bit of 
      conservation from all of us can make a difference. 
 
      On the medical front, Dr. Emily 
      Senay showed us a few alarming Web
sites that are selling fake drugs that can potentially be 
      harmful. In this scam, which is new to me, Web
sites offer you a drug -- for 
      weight loss or depression, for instance -- and in fact send you something completely different. Please check 
      our Web site for the list of scam Web
sites that are doing 
      this.
 
 

Also this 
      morning,  the "Chic on a Shoestring" segment was one of the best we've 
      had in a long time.  The splurges and the steals were so close to one 
      another in appearance that none 
      of us got all of them 
      right. The one that was hardest for me was the second look -- the bags, the sandals, the tops, 
      the pants, all the pieces on our models looked so similar. I was 
      completely stumped!  Our viewer who played along, Margaret from Yorba Linda, Calif., was a great sport and tied with 
      me, Hannah and Dave. Visit our 
      homepage if you'd like to see the 
details. 
 
 

And, Barbara O'Dair from More 
      magazine offered great advice for all moms, whether they're single or married: she says 
      they should save for their own retirement before saving 
      for the child's college 
      education.  Her main point was that unless you can guarantee that your 
      child will take care of you in your retirement years, you should not put 
      their college education ahead of what 
      your needs will be as 
      you get older. Teaching your kids to 
      help pay for their own education is also something she stressed and I can 
      understand.  It's never too early to teach a child the importance 
      of being 
      self-sufficient!
 
 
Tomorrow on the Early 
      Show, one of People magazine's 
      most beautiful people, Drew Barrymore, will be live in the studio to 
      discuss her new film "Lucky You." Another 
      beauty, "Spider- Man 3" star Kirsten Dunst, will talk about the making of that trilogy and Il Divo will perform for us.
 
      


Julie
